channel.title: Need help to get started
channel.description: im new to minecraft and it looked really interesting and wanted to try it out. How do i connect to this and get everything started?

item.title: Need help to get started
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

[quote=".::Ix Miir xI::., post:6, topic:393986"][quote author=noobs are ftw link=topic=491171.msg3592106#msg3592106 date=1304728121]

Alright that helps, only once more question… where do I download minecraft? Or could I get it at minecraft.net for free?

getting it for free is illegal but the people here do it anyway but i got no worries since i payed for it

Minecraft.net

Official site

Minecraft is a game about placing blocks and going on adventures. Buy it here, or explore the site for the latest news and the community's amazing creations!


[/quote]
Hmm, well I can’t really pay for it… Do you know where I could get for free?[/quote]
Look in the tutorials section. I have a cracked launcher there you can use.

Read full topic

item.title: Need help to get started
item.dc:creator: @loled2 loled2
item.description:
@loled2 wrote:

.::Ix Miir xI::.:

im new to minecraft and it looked really interesting and wanted to try it out. How do i connect to this and get everything started?

Q: How do i connect?
A: first of all do you have a .minecraft folder and a minecraft client?

If you have run the client and press “Multiplayer” and Write “minecraft.moparisthebest.com” or “moparcraft.net”

If you dont have i will give you a .jar client

How do i survive?
first you need to get the basics before night or some later like
Wood (1stack raw wood)
Cobblestone (10+)
Coal (arround the 10-20)
Tools (my tip. first only wooden pick and if you have 3-10 cobble get better tools)
Dirt (30+)
the stuff there can be more or less

later if you have them you go build a house, underground-underwater base
first make a small and later build what you want:)

for crafting press “I”
to know what are the Recipes
http://www.minecraftwiki.net/wiki/Crafting

this is the most stuff you need to know to survive and connect:) hope this helps you

Read full topic
